abstract: The Reader’s Digest Association won bankruptcy court approval for an outline of its turnaround plan after creditors withdrew their objections.
snippet: The Reader’s Digest Association won bankruptcy court approval for an outline of its turnaround plan after creditors withdrew their objections.
lead_paragraph: The Reader’s Digest Association won bankruptcy court approval for an outline of its turnaround plan after revisions prompted bondholders, a pension trustee and the United States to withdraw their objections. Judge Robert D. Drain of the United States Bankruptcy Court in Manhattan said on Tuesday that he would approve the so-called disclosure statement, which explains terms of the reorganization to creditors.
